page.title: 10Western Southall
page.content: Most people come from India,Pakistan and Bangladesh.It is called the Common wealth. It smelt of Asian things, spices, herbs and curries.The women mainly wore Saris but sone wore the sort of dress we wear.We passed Temples which had a faint sound of Indian music.Most of the people spoke in their own language but some could speak both their own and ours. Most of the shops were General Stores and Video shops.There were lots of restaurants smelling of curry. There were lots of cars lined up along the roads. There were long rows of Terraces and some very small Maisonettes.None had garages.The houses were not looked after very well.All the paint was peeling off window ledges and doors. The gardens were messy and the net curtains dirty and old. By Yvonne Sells.
